title: Monthly Local SEO Management
content:
Monthly Local SEO Management That Keeps You Ranking

Local SEO isn't a one-time project. Google's algorithm changes. Competitors optimize their profiles. New businesses enter your market. If you're not actively managing your local presence, you fall behind.

Monthly local SEO management keeps you ranking, keeps your Google Business Profile active, and keeps fresh content flowing so you stay ahead of competitors.

LocalCatalyst's monthly management service includes GBP posts, content updates, ranking tracking, review responses, and ongoing optimization — everything you need to maintain and improve your local search rankings.

What Is Monthly Local SEO Management?

Monthly local SEO management is an ongoing service that keeps your local search presence optimized, active, and competitive.

Think of it like maintaining a car. You don't just buy a car and never change the oil. Local SEO is the same — you need regular maintenance to keep performing.

What monthly management includes:

1. Google Business Profile Management
Weekly posts, photo uploads, Q&A management, review responses, and insight reporting.

2. Content Updates
Fresh blog posts, service page updates, location page refinements, and seasonal content.

3. Ranking Tracking & Reporting
Weekly keyword tracking, monthly performance reports, competitor analysis.

4. Technical SEO Monitoring
Site speed checks, mobile optimization, broken link fixes, schema updates.

5. Strategic Adjustments
Based on performance data, we adjust strategy — prioritize different keywords, add new location pages, shift content focus, etc.

Why Your Business Needs Ongoing Local SEO

1. Google Rewards Active Profiles

Businesses that post weekly to their Google Business Profile, upload fresh photos, and respond to reviews rank higher than stale profiles.

2. Competitors Are Optimizing

If you optimize once and stop, your competitors will pass you. Local SEO is competitive — you need to stay active to stay ahead.

3. Algorithm Changes Affect Rankings

Google updates its local search algorithm multiple times per year. Monthly management means we adapt quickly to changes so your rankings stay stable.

4. Content Ages

A blog post that ranks today may not rank in 6 months. We refresh underperforming content, add new content, and keep your site relevant.

5. Reviews Compound

The more reviews you generate each month, the stronger your reputation gets. Monthly management includes ongoing review generation and responses.

What's Included

Google Business Profile Management

  • 4 GBP posts per month (Updates, Offers, Events)
  • Weekly photo uploads (team, work, location)
  • Q&A management (answer customer questions, seed helpful FAQs)
  • Review monitoring & responses (respond to all reviews within 24 hours)
  • Monthly GBP insights report (views, clicks, calls, direction requests)

Content Creation & Updates

  • 1-2 blog posts per month (800-1,500 words, locally-focused, keyword-optimized)
  • Service page updates (refresh underperforming pages, add new sections)
  • Location page updates (add new service areas, update existing pages)
  • Seasonal content (holiday hours, seasonal services, local events)

Ranking Tracking & Reporting

  • Weekly keyword tracking (track 10-20 target keywords)
  • Monthly performance report (rankings, traffic, conversions)
  • Competitor analysis (your rankings vs. top 3 competitors)
  • Insights & recommendations (what's working, what needs adjustment)

Technical SEO Monitoring

  • Site speed checks (monthly performance audit)
  • Mobile optimization (ensure mobile-friendly design)
  • Broken link fixes (identify and fix 404 errors)
  • Schema updates (add or refine schema markup as needed)

Strategic Adjustments

Based on monthly performance data, we:

  • Adjust keyword targeting
  • Add new location or service pages
  • Shift content focus
  • Experiment with new GBP post formats
  • Optimize underperforming pages

How Monthly Management Works

Week 1: GBP Posts & Photos

We create and publish 1 GBP post, upload fresh photos, and respond to any new reviews.

Week 2: Content Creation

We write and publish 1 blog post or update an existing service/location page.

Week 3: GBP Posts & Q&A

We publish another GBP post and manage Q&A (answer new questions, seed helpful ones).

Week 4: Reporting & Planning

We compile your monthly report (rankings, traffic, GBP insights) and plan next month's strategy based on performance data.

This cycle repeats every month. You get consistent activity, fresh content, and continuous optimization.

Investment

Monthly Local SEO Management: $800/month

Includes:

  • GBP management (4 posts, photos, Q&A, review responses)
  • 1-2 blog posts or content updates per month
  • Weekly keyword tracking
  • Monthly performance report
  • Technical SEO monitoring
  • Strategic adjustments

À La Carte Add-Ons:

  • +$200/month: 2 additional blog posts
  • +$150/month: Additional location page (new service area)
  • +$100/month: Advanced competitor tracking (5+ competitors)

Frequently Asked Questions

Q1: Can I pause the service if I need to?
A: Yes. We operate on a month-to-month basis. You can pause or cancel anytime with 30 days' notice.

Q2: What if I want more than 2 blog posts per month?
A: We can add more content for an additional fee ($200/month for 2 more posts). Just let us know.

Q3: Do you handle multiple locations?
A: Yes. Pricing is per location. If you have 3 locations, we can manage all 3 (each gets its own GBP posts, content, and reporting).

Q4: How do I access my monthly reports?
A: We send reports via email on the 1st of each month. You can also access a live dashboard (if you prefer) where you can check rankings and traffic anytime.

Q5: What if my rankings drop?
A: Rankings fluctuate. If we see a drop, we investigate (algorithm change? competitor activity? technical issue?) and adjust strategy immediately. You'll be notified within 48 hours.

Q6: Can I request specific content topics?
A: Absolutely. We plan content based on keyword research, but if you have a specific topic or question you want covered, just tell us and we'll prioritize it.

Q7: Do you work with our internal marketing team?
A: Yes. If you have an in-house marketer or external agency handling other aspects (paid ads, social media), we collaborate seamlessly.
